utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh, Ross, Mon, is it okay if I bring someone to your parent’s anniversary party?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Sure. Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: So, who’s the guy?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Well, his name is Parker and I met him at the drycleaners.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oooh, did he put a little starch in your bloomers? Who said that?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Yeah, he’s really great though. He has this incredible zest for life, and he treats me like a queen, except at night when he treats me like the naughty girl I am.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh, by the way. Would it be okay if I gave the toast to mom and dad this year?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Uh, yeah, you sure you want to after what happened at their 20th?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Yeah, I’d really like to.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Okay, hopefully this time mom won’t boo you.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Yes! Every year Ross makes the toast, and it’s always really moving, and always makes them cry. Well this year I’m going to make them cry.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: And you wonder why Ross is their favorite?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: No! Really! Any time Ross makes a toast everyone cries, and hugs him, and pats him on the back and they all come up to me and say, "God, your brother." Know what they’ll say this year? "God, you"

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Well I can promise you, at least one person will be crying. I’m an actor, and any actor worth himself can cry on cue.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Really you can do that?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Are you kidding me? Watch! Well I can’t do it with you guys watching me!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: What are you doing?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh I’m working on my toast for the party, or as I like to call it. Sob fest 2002. Hey check this out.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: It’s a dog.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: It’s a dead dog. That’s Chi-Chi; she died when I was in high school.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: It’s your parents’ anniversary and you’re going to talk about their dead pet?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: The good stuff, huh?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Hi!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: You got a present for my parents. That’s so sweet.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Yeah, yeah, in honor of their 35th wedding anniversary, I had a star named after them.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Aww that is so cool.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: And I got them a book on Karma Sutra for the elderly.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Hey, do you guys have any extra ribbon?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Yeah, sure. What do you need? We got lace, satin, sateen, raffia, gingham, felt, and I think my testacles may be in here too.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Aww! Chi-Chi! Oh, I loved this dog! Y’know Monica couldn’t get braces because Chi-Chi needed knee surgery.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: What?!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: You were the 200-pound 11-year-old who rode her!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: All
utterance.content: Hi!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Everybody, this is Parker, Parker this is…

utterance.speaker: Parker
utterance.content: No, no, no wait! Don’t tell me. Let me guess. Joey, Monica, Ross, Rachel and, I’m sorry Phoebe didn’t mention you. Chandler, I’m kidding all ready you’re my favorite!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Ha!

utterance.speaker: Parker
utterance.content: Why don’t all of you tell me a little about your self?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Ah, actually, I’m sorry we-we probably should get going.

utterance.speaker: Parker
utterance.content: Classic Ross. Rachel, Rachel, oh how you glow. May I?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I, uh, think you already are.

utterance.speaker: Parker
utterance.content: Rachel, you have life growing inside you. Is there anything in this world more miraculous than—Oh a picture of a dog! Whose is this?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: That’s my old dog. He passed away years ago.

utterance.speaker: Parker
utterance.content: Oh well, at least you were lucky to have him. Bow-wow old friend, bow-wow. So where’s the party?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: It’s out on the island. It’s in Massapequa.

utterance.speaker: Parker
utterance.content: Maaaassapequa, sounds like a magical place. Tell me about Massapequa, is it steep in Native American history? {Transcriber’s Note: Interestingly Alec Baldwin was born in Massapequa.}

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Well, there is an Arby’s in the shape of a tee-pee.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Okay, I got my note cards. Do you got the presents?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: And I’ve got the car keys.

utterance.speaker: Parker
utterance.content: We’re driving!?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Parker
utterance.content: Aces!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: So uh, he seems like a nice guy.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yeah, yeah I like him a lot.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Ya wanna hang back and take our own cab?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yeah, otherwise I’m not going.

utterance.speaker: Mr. and Mrs. Geller
utterance.content: Hi

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hi! Hey mom.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: This is such a great party! 35 years. Very impressive, do you guys have any pearls of wisdom?

utterance.speaker: Mrs. Geller
utterance.content: Jack?

utterance.speaker: Mr. Geller
utterance.content: Why would you serve food on such a sharp stick?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: That’s a good question, dad. That’s a good question…

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Hmmm….

utterance.speaker: Woman
utterance.content: Congratulations you two!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Thank you…we’re so excited

utterance.speaker: Woman
utterance.content: And also, congratulations on your wedding.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Wha—What?

utterance.speaker: Mrs. Geller
utterance.content: Can we talk to you for just a y’know… It’s just a little thing. Well we think it’s absolutely marvelous that you’re having this baby out of wedlock, some of our friends are less open-minded. Which is why we’ve told them all that you’re married.

utterance.speaker: Ross and Rachel
utterance.content: What?!

utterance.speaker: Mrs. Geller
utterance.content: Thanks for going along with this.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Dad so what we have to pretend that we’re married?

utterance.speaker: Mr. Geller
utterance.content: Son, I had to shave my ears for tonight. You can do this.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Can you believe that?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yeah, if you’re going to do the ears, you might as well take a pass at the nosal area.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: No, us having to lie about being married.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: No, I know I don’t either, but ya know what, it’s their party, and it’s just one night. And we don’t even have to lie; we just won’t say anything. If it comes up again, we’ll just…smile. We’ll nod along.

utterance.speaker: Woman
utterance.content: Ross!

utterance.speaker: Man
utterance.content: Rachel!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hi Aunt Lisa, Uncle Dan

utterance.speaker: Aunt Lisa
utterance.content: Congratulations on the baby, and on the wedding

utterance.speaker: Ross and Rachel
utterance.content: Hmmmm….

utterance.speaker: Uncle Dan
utterance.content: Here’s a little something to get you started.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh…

utterance.speaker: Aunt Lisa
utterance.content: So, how’s married life treating you?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Unbelievable!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: We love marriage!

utterance.speaker: Aunt Lisa
utterance.content: Great!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hey

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Parker
utterance.content: What a beautiful place. What a great night! I have to tell you, being here with all of you in Event Room C…I feel so lucky. I think of all the good times that have happened here. The birthdays, the proms, the mitzvahs both bar and bat, but none of them will compare with tonight! My God, I don’t want to forget this moment! It’s like I want to take a mental picture of you all! Click!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I don’t think the flash went off.

utterance.speaker: Parker
utterance.content: Dahaaa! I’m going to find the men’s room, be right back.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: I’ll go with you

utterance.speaker: Parker
utterance.content: Come on!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Somewhere there is someone with a tranquilizer gun and a huge butterfly net looking for that man.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: I have to go to the bathroom too, but I don’t want him complimenting my thing.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I’m so we weren’t in the car! Did he ever let up?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: He called the Long Island Expressway a concrete miracle.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: This room! This night! That waiter! His shoes! I must take a mental picture! Ooh sorry…

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Were you guys making fun of Parker?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: That depends, how much did you hear?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: So, he a little enthusiastic, what’s wrong with that?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: It’s just that, it’s so much.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Well, so what I like him! Do I make fun of the people you’ve dated? Tag, Janice, Mona? No, because friends don’t do that. But, do you want my opinion? Do you want it? ‘Cause in my opinion, your collective dating record reads like the who’s who of human crap.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I feel terrible.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: I know

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: What was wrong with Mona?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Open it! Open it! Open it!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Yeah baby!

utterance.speaker: Man
utterance.content: So we never got to hear about your wedding!

utterance.speaker: Woman
utterance.content: We were surprise that we weren’t invited.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: No, no, it was just our parents and 1 or 2 friends. It was a small wedding.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: But it was beautiful. I mean it was small, but kind of spectacular.

utterance.speaker: Man
utterance.content: Where did you have it?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: On a cliff, in Barbados, at sunset, and Stevie Wonder sang Isn’t She Lovely as I walked down the aisle.

utterance.speaker: Woman
utterance.content: Really?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yeah, Stevie’s an old family friend.

utterance.speaker: Woman
utterance.content: Oh my God. That sounds amazing. I would love to see pictures.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: So would I. You wouldn’t think that Annie Liebawitz would forget to put film in the camera.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Would you excuse us for a second? Umm…. what are you doing?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: What? I’m not you. This may be the only wedding I ever have. I want it to be amazing.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Okay, okay. Ooooh, ooh maybe I rode in on a Harley.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Okay, Ross, it has to be realistic.

utterance.speaker: Parker
utterance.content: Are you okay? You seem kind of quiet.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: No, I’m fine. I’m great. I’m with you.

utterance.speaker: Parker
utterance.content: And I’m with you! What a great time to be alive! Look at this plate-bouncy thing. What an inspired solution to man’s plate dispensing problems.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Hm huh, yeah.

utterance.speaker: Parker
utterance.content: Ah! Oysters! Let me feed you one.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: No, that’s not necessary.

utterance.speaker: Parker
utterance.content: Please.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: No, actually I don’t eat…

utterance.speaker: Parker
utterance.content: I won’t quit until you try.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Okay, fine! Fine! Mmm…hmmmmm….

utterance.speaker: Parker
utterance.content: What are they like? I’ve never had one.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Why don’t you just try one?

utterance.speaker: Parker
utterance.content: No, they look too weird.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: What are you doin’?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Just going over my toast. Those two will never know what hit ‘em. I can’t wait. They’re going to be crying so hard. They’re going to be fighting for breath.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Ya know if you want to, I can just hold them down and you could .

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: And my veil was lace, made by blind, Belgium nuns.

utterance.speaker: Woman
utterance.content: Blind?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Well, not at first, but it was very intricate work and they said even though they lost their sight, it was all worth it.

utterance.speaker: Aunt Lisa
utterance.content: I’ll bet you looked beautiful…

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Well, I don’t know about that, but some said that I looked like a floating angel.

utterance.speaker: Woman
utterance.content: So, how did you propose?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh yeah. That’s a great story.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Well, um, actually, I-I took her to the planetarium. That’s-that’s where we had our first date. Um, she walked in and I had the room filled with lilies, her favorite flower…

utterance.speaker: Aunt Lisa
utterance.content: Oh that is so sweet!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Shhh! I want to hear the rest!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Then, Fred Astaire singing The Way You Look Tonight came on the sound system, and the lights came down. And I got down on one knee and written across the dome in the stars were the words "Will you marry me?"

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: And the ring, was the size of my fist !

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Yeah uh, Phoebe! Look umm, I want to apologize about before, okay? We were being jerks. Parker’s a nice guy and I’d like to get to know him.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Then you better do it now.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Why?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Because I’m going to kill him

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: What-what?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: You guys were right. He’s just too excited about…everything. I mean I’m all for living life, but this is the Geller’s 35th anniversary. Okay? Let’s call a spade a spade this party stinks.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: I know I’m having the worst time. There was a 15-minute line for the buffet, and when I finally got up to the plates, I slipped on a giant booger!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Are you sure it wasn’t an oyster?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: I guess it could’ve been, I didn’t really look at it. Y’know, I just wiped it on Chandler’s coat and got the hell out of there.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: He’s just such a great guy I’m so excited about him.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oh hey, you should be excited about him. There’s nothing wrong with him he’s a good guy.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: You think?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Yeah. Ya know what I think; I think we were all just being too negative.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: You’re right. You’re right, he’s just embracing life. We could all stand to be a little more like Parker. You know what? I am like him! I’m a sunny, positive person.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Actually, you have a little bit of an edge.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: What’s that now?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Nothing…

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh look it’s Parker!

utterance.speaker: Parker
utterance.content: Look! It’s the bunny hop!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oooh I love it!

utterance.speaker: Parker
utterance.content: You do?!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Are you kidding? People acting like animals to music. Come on!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Okay it’s time for the toast! Umm now-now, I know that Ross usually gives the toast, but this year I’m going to do it.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: No, no it’s going to be great. Really! Mom, Dad, when I got married, one of the things that made me sure I could do it was the amazing example the two of you set for me. For that and so many other things I want to say thank you. I know I probably don’t say it enough, but I love you. When I look around this room, I’m-I’m saddened by the thought of those who could not be here with us. Nana, my beloved grandmother who would so want to be here, but she can’t because she’s dead. As is our dog Chi-Chi. I mean look how cute she is. . Was. Do me a favor and pass this to my parents. Remember she’s dead. Okay, her and Nana, gone. Wow! Hey does anybody remember when Debra Winger had to say goodbye to her children in Terms of Endearment? Didn’t see that? No movie fans?! You want to hear something sad? The other day I was watching 60 Minutes these orphans in Romania, who have been so neglected, they were incapable of love. You people are made of stone! Here’s to mom and dad! Whatever!

utterance.speaker: Mrs. Geller
utterance.content: Thank you Monica that was uh, interesting. Wasn’t it interesting, Jack?

utterance.speaker: Mr. Geller
utterance.content: Why don’t I remember this dog?

utterance.speaker: Mrs. Geller
utterance.content: Ross, why don’t you give us your toast now?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Oh, no, Mom, it’s just Monica this year.

utterance.speaker: Mrs. Geller
utterance.content: You’re not going to say anything? On our 35th wedding anniversary

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: No, of course, Um… Um, everybody? Um, I-I just wanted to say…on behalf of my new bride, Rachel , and myself. Umm, that if…if in 35 years, we’re half as happy as you guys are, we’ll count ourselves the luckiest people in the world.

utterance.speaker: Mrs. Geller
utterance.content: Oh Ross…

utterance.speaker: Mr. Geller
utterance.content: I just wish Nana were alive to hear Ross’s toast.

utterance.speaker: Parker
utterance.content: My God what a fantastically well lit hallway!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Can I get you something to drink? Like a water and Valium?

utterance.speaker: Parker
utterance.content: I must say this apartment, its, its, There are no words…

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh thank God.

utterance.speaker: Parker
utterance.content: It’s a haven. A third-floor paradise. A modern-day Eden in the midst…

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Yeah? I know! I know! Uh huh? Listen why don’t we just um, sit and relax? You know just be with each other. Quietly!

utterance.speaker: Parker
utterance.content: That sounds great. My God this is the most comfortable couch I’ve ever sat on in my entire life.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Let’s try something else, let’s play a game.

utterance.speaker: Parker
utterance.content: I love games!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Shocking! Let’s play the game of who can stay quiet the longest.

utterance.speaker: Parker
utterance.content: Or…Jenga.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: But, let’s play this one first. And remember whoever talks first loses!

utterance.speaker: Parker
utterance.content: I lose, now Jenga.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh my God! Oh my God!

utterance.speaker: Parker
utterance.content: Is something wrong?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Wrong? Really? You know the word wrong. Everything isn’t perfect? Everything isn’t magical? Everything isn’t a glow with the light of a million fairies? They were just brake lights, Parker!

utterance.speaker: Parker
utterance.content: Well, excuse me for putting a good spin on a traffic jam!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: You don’t have to put a good spin on everything.

utterance.speaker: Parker
utterance.content: I’m sorry that’s who I am. I’m a positive person.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: No! I am a positive person. You are like Santa Clause on Prozac, at Disneyland, getting laid!

utterance.speaker: Parker
utterance.content: So what do you want me to do, you want me to be more negative, less happy?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Much less happy!

utterance.speaker: Parker
utterance.content: Fine! Well then to quote Ross, "I’d better be going."

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: So long! Don’t let the best door in the world hit you in the ass on your way out!

utterance.speaker: Parker
utterance.content: Isn’t this the most incredible fight you’ve ever had in your entire life?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Uh huh.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: …and then, we could’ve gone from the ceremony to the reception with you in the sidecar!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Ross, it just wouldn’t have been feasible.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: But having a dove place the ring on your finger would’ve been no problem?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: It was really fun being married to you tonight.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Yeah! And! And, it was the easiest 400 bucks I’ve ever made.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Okay Ross, can I uh, can I ask you something?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: That proposal, at the planetarium…

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I know, I know it was stupid.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Are you kidding?! With the, with the lilies, and-and the song, and the stars! It was…really wonderful! Did you just make that up?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: No, actually I thought about it when, when we were going out. It’s how I imagined I uh, I would ask you to marry me.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Well, that would’ve been very hard to say no too.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: It’s a good thing I didn’t do it, because it sounds like it would’ve been a very expensive wedding. Okay, good night

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Goodnight

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Even if the sidecar had a windscreen so your hair wouldn’t get messed up?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I will think about it.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: That’s all I’m askin’

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Okay that’s it. I give up. At mom and dad’s 40th anniversary, you’re the one giving the speech.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Y’know I don’t understand why they didn’t cry. It was a beautiful speech.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh, come on.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hey! All that stuff you said about true love, you were right, I mean, we did learn a lot from Mom and Dad! And that picture of Chi-Chi with her mischievous grin. And what you said about Nana. Ohh, yeah she really would’ve wanted to be there. And you know what? I think she was.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh good God, Ross! How the hell do you do it?
